page.title: 11Recreation 2 - Yardley
page.content: The hours of the week spent by a family on recreation varied,the least being about ten and the most about forty,but on average people seem to spend about twenty five to thirty hours a week on leisure activities.One family spent as much as 25 pounds each per week on their leisure,mainly because they went to the pub every night,but two retired people spent only one pound each.On average adults seem to spend about five to ten pounds and children two pounds. Hobbies were very varied.Men mentioned darts,drinking and car maintenance, women walking and knitting and children things like dancing,swimming, and playing computer games.Going to the pub was the most popular outing,not many people going to the cinema,the theatre or to play bingo.Some families did go out for a meal for an outing but otherwise did not do a lot together.
